inputs.name: ScheduledTaskName
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The full path of the Scheduled Task to install on the server(s).
If the Scheduled Task is to be installed in a directory, the directory (or directories) must also be included in the path.
e.g. `MyTasks\TaskToInstall`

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskDescription
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: A description of what the Scheduled Task does.

inputs.name: ApplicationPathToRun
inputs.label: Application Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full path of the application or script to run on the server.

inputs.name: ApplicationArguments
inputs.label: Application Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the appliation or script.

inputs.name: ScheduleTriggerType
inputs.label: Schedule Trigger
inputs.helpMarkDown: What event should trigger the Scheduled Task to run.

options.AtLogOn: When a user log on (At Log On)
options.AtStartup: When the system is started (At Startup)

inputs.name: ScheduleStartTime
inputs.label: Start Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: The time that the Scheduled Task should start at.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyOptions
inputs.label: Schedule Frequency
inputs.helpMarkDown: How often the Scheduled Task should be ran.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyDailyInterval
inputs.label: Daily Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: How many days between running the Scheduled Task. e.g. 1 = every day, 2 = every other day, 3 = every third day, etc.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyInterval
inputs.label: Weekly Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: How many weeks between running the Scheduled Task. e.g. 1 = every week, 2 = every other week, 3 = every third week, etc.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunMulipleTimesAWeek
inputs.label: Run multiple times a week
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on specific days of the week.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnMondays
inputs.label: Monday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Mondays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnTuesdays
inputs.label: Tuesday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Tuesdays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnWednesdays
inputs.label: Wednesday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Wednesdays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnThursdays
inputs.label: Thursday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Thursdays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnFridays
inputs.label: Friday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Fridays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnSaturdays
inputs.label: Saturday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Saturdays.

inputs.name: ScheduleFrequencyWeeklyRunOnSundays
inputs.label: Sunday
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run on Sundays.

inputs.name: ScheduleShouldRepeat
inputs.label: Repeat the Scheduled Task
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run repeatedly again after being triggered.

inputs.name: ScheduleRepetitionInterval
inputs.label: Repetition Interval (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: How long to wait after the Scheduled Task is triggered before triggering it again. e.g. A value of 60 will trigger the Scheduled Task every hour.

inputs.name: ScheduleRepetitionDuration
inputs.label: Repetition Duration (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of minutes to continue triggering the Scheduled Task for after it was initially triggered. e.g. A value of 1440 would allow the Repetition Interval to retrigger the task for 24 hours.

inputs.name: ScheduleStartTimeRandomDelay
inputs.label: Start Time Random Delay (in Minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum amount of minutes to delay the start time of the trigger. The delay will be a random value between zero and the number of minutes specified here.

inputs.name: ScheduldTaskUserToRunAsOptions
inputs.label: User To Run As
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user that the Scheduled Task should run as.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskUserToRunAs
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the user or system account that the Scheduled Task should run as.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskUserToRunAsPassword
inputs.label: Scheduled Task Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The password of the user or system account that the Scheduled Task should run as.

As a best practice, a secret variable should be passed in here so that other users cannot see the password in plain text.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskShouldBeEnabled
inputs.label: Enabled
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task be enabled after it is installed; Unselect this to have it be installed as disabled.

inputs.name: ScheduledTaskShouldRunAfterInstall
inputs.label: Run after installed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to have the Scheduled Task run immediately after it is installed.

inputs.name: ComputerNames
inputs.label: Computer Names
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A comma-separated list of computers to connect to and install the Scheduled Task on.

Leave blank to have it run on the agent's local computer.

inputs.name: Username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The username to use when connecting to the computers and installing the Scheduled Task.

Leave blank to use the identity that the agent is running as.

inputs.name: Password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The password to use when connecting to the computers and installing the Scheduled Task.

As a best practice, a secret variable should be passed in here so that other users cannot see the password in plain text.

Leave blank to use the identity that the agent is running as.

inputs.name: samplepathinput
inputs.label: Sample Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: A sample path which is relative to root of repo if empty

inputs.name: samplestring
inputs.label: Sample String
inputs.helpMarkDown: A sample string

inputs.name: samplebool
inputs.label: Sample Boolean
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

inputs.name: targetType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target script type: File Path or Inline

inputs.name: filePath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your powershell commands here.

Write-Host "Hello World"

# Use the environment variables input below to pass secret variables to this script.

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference = 'VALUE'` at the top of your script.
